intro: Scorzonera multiscapa, commonly known as the mountain scorzonera, is a perennial herb native to the mountainous regions of Central Asia. It belongs to the family Asteraceae and is characterized by its hairy, leafy stems and yellow to orange flowers. The plant produces a taproot that is often used in traditional medicine for its purported health benefits. It thrives in well-drained soils and is adapted to cold, high-altitude environments. Scorzonera multiscapa is also valued for its ornamental appeal and ecological role in alpine ecosystems.
